dialogues.text: Alexander stands, utterly staggered, looking down into a valley. And he sees... A city... not exactly... s sculpture... no... Imagine Monument Valley. Man-made. Twisting spires and towers and monoliths shoot up for a hundred feet, swirling multicolored constructions of sand stone. They are mammoth creations that bend and twist and  soar, filling the valley. There is a bizarre sort of architectural order to the creation, yet it is also inspi and mad and emotional.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Our work. They begin to descend into the valley with the rest of th Eloi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the towers now, Alexander sees the fabulous detail the constructions. They are beautiful, soaring combinatio of mud and stone sculpture; fabric and wood; sand and flowers. It is ethereal pyramid building: primitive creation of stunning artistic courage and clarity. Already the Eloi are busy. Like a race of master builders, they climb wooden scaffoldings and scale ropes -- swarming busily around th towers like insects -- unified in their task of amazing artistic creation. Alexander and Mara move through the towers.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: This is magnificent...

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: And this is your "work"?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Yes. They pass some Eloi carrying mud from a nearby river to t towers.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: (dry) The mud carriers.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I can see Kalen's point.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Want to be a high climber now, do you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What you need is an engineer. If  you set up a system of pulleys and counterweights, some basic block and tackle mechanism, you could to this a lot more easily.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: It's not supposed to be easy, it's supposed to be beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What's it all for?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I mean, why do you do it? What purpose does it serve?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: It has no purpose. It's just beautiful... Does everything have a purpose where you come from?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Most things. We're very high on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: It's always been this way here. We work on the towers all our lives. When we're young we train to be planners or climbers or sculptors...

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Or mud carriers.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: And there's no shame to that. It's all the same here. Everyone has an important job to do. We all work together and couldn't survive without each other.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What are you?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: I'ma planner. I help decide where the new towers go and what they should look like.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: How do you decide?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: I try to imagine how they'll look when they're done. I try to imagine how we'll fit in with them... our place in the world. Alexander is impressed with her quiet words, own creative passion. He stops, taking in the communal activity eve him for a moment. Enjoying the warm sunshine surroundings. Paradise. He continues to gaze at the towers, smiling. him, almost on the verge of saying something. against it.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: We should go if you want to see your machine. They continue on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first stars are beginning to shine in the so much like his rywhere around and peaceful Mara looks at She decides night sky as Alexander and Mara make their way across an open field.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: .. It was a great city. The greatest city in the world.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: You liked it there.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Oh, very much... (he points) .. I used to work somewhere in that direction, I think. A huge university where we taught everything from botany to history to literature.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Learning was important?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Oh very. Learning, commerce, the arts -- the whole place was buzzing all the time. Night and day.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Did you have fires at night?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Only to keep warm. For illumination we had gaslights on most of the streets and a new invention called electrical lighting that made it seem like daylight all through the night.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: It must have been safe.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Oh, it was... (beat) .. Most of the time.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: It sounds like a wonderful place to live.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Looking back... I suppose it was. I didn't quite realize it at the time but... Alexander stops, frozen. Staring up.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Alexander...?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (quietly) Orion's belt... The constellation gleams in the sky. The string of three stars pointing to the earth. Exactly as it was on the nig Emma died. Alexander looks around, amazed, getting his bearings:

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Those rocks, over there... they're the same... this is... Central Park.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: You know this?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Over there was Fifth Avenue -- and the Plaza Hotel was there... this is... the carriage path. We're on the carriage path. A stunning realization for Alexander. The stars and rock formations confirming his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: The whole world is different. But  this never changes... A long beat as he looks around, his eyes full of pain. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: This is where my journey started... right here.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: You lost someone.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Someone you loved very much.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yes... After her death, it was intolerable for me here... The future had to be better.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: If you only knew... He looks at her deeply.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You've welcomed me into your home. Into your lives. Everyone has... For the first time in a long time it doesn't hurt quite so much. I thank you for that.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: I know what it is to lose someone. When my husband was taken from us... I thought the pain would never end. She gently touches his face. A beat. She

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: But time helps. She breaks the moment, turning:

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Now let's see this amazing machine of yours. moves off. He takes one final glance at Orion's belt, and then follows. One of the squirrel-like creatures scampers after them a then stops -- and something bizarre happens -- the squirr jaws distend unnaturally -- and it vomits forth an eyebal The human-looking eyeball oscillates on a thick mechanica tendril. Watching Alexander and Mara. Spying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Time Machine awaits. It sits at the edge of some thic jungle foliage. Alexander goes to it. Mara following. He circles the machine, checking it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Good -- it looks fine. We had quite a ride together...

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: It's undamaged?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yes... a little scorching on the upholstery but otherwise all ship- shape.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: So you can use it now?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yes... I suppose so.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Go back to your own time?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I could... Suddenly, she is a different person -- she takes his arm firmly, her eyes burning into his:

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: (urgently) Alexander, take my son away. Take him back to your time. Will you do that?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Mara --

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Please, I beg you. Take him away from here -- And then... A mournful wailing stabs through the night. A distant ho Mara freezes. Her eyes wide in horror.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Kalen...

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Mara...?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: No! She turns and bolts, racing away from him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Mara!? He runs after her -- leaving the Time Machine behind --

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Wait -- tell me -- ! Then a frenzy of movement draws his attention back to the Time Machine for a moment -- He just sees the Time Machine as it is DRAGGED AWAY -- amazingly quickly -- something violently hauling it into darkness of the jungle in an instant -- the jungle swallo it up -- Alexander slams to a stop -- amazed -- and then turns to follow Mara --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander and Mara race through the deep forest -- she is running flat out -- he struggles to keep up --

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Mara -- what -- ?!

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Kalen -- we have to get Kalen -- ! A building thunder in the forest behind them -- Something approaching -- a crashing cacophony of somethin thrashing quickly through the trees -- closer and closer the earth vibrating, something pounding after them -- Another horn call, closer -- Dark shapes sweeping through the forest behind them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander and Mara speed into the valley from the darkne the forest -- The Eloi ahead of them are just standing. Waiting. A terrible moment of stasis, terror in their eyes. The worl coiled.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Kalen -- ! An EXPLOSION of horror as the MORLOCKS appear -- They erupt from the dark forest into the valley -- The Morlocks are horrible, muscular creatures with unnaturally long and distended jaws and ferocious, huge c like those of a mole -- And they ride horribly mutated horses and let out ferocio animal roars. About twenty mounted Morlocks sweep into the valley -- th Eloi scatter in terror. It is a hunt. The Eloi race in panic, so utterly unlike the beatific ca of the rest of their lives -- and everywhere the Morlocks pursue -- weaving in and out of the Eloi towers and swing heavy nets -- capturing Eloi and dragging them away -- The Eloi scramble desperately to protect their children - the Morlocks are brutal -- great claws slamming Eloi asid snatching them up -- nets swinging -- the Eloi never real resist -- once they are captured they allow the Morlocks pull them away -- By now the sun is fully setting and it is an unearthly spectacle in the blood red dusk, made even more bizarre b the glowing red eyes of the Morlocks -- Mara and Alexander race through the mammoth constructions

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: Everywhere around them the Morlocks are netting Eloi and dragging them away -- But it is not random. The Morlocks seem to target particu Eloi. A Morlock spins on his horse, his glowing red eyes fasten Mara. He spurs his horse and gallops toward Mara and Alexander. Alexander sees the Morlock pursuing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way! He pulls Mara towards one of the towers -- The Morlock gallops toward them -- swinging his net -- th net traps Mara -- Alexander spins around and grabs the ne he yanks at it violently and pulls the Morlock from his horse -- The Morlock slams to the ground -- the horse bolts off -- Morlock snarls and slashes at Alexander quickly and then, his absolute shock, the Morlock dives into the earth -- h tunnels away with his huge claws in a frenzy of movement disappearing into the ground -- Alexander pulls Mara from the net and hauls her up -- He pulls her to one of the towers and begins climbing, hauling her after him, away from the Morlocks -- Another Morlock fastens his crimson eyes on Mara, gallops toward them -- swings his net up -- can't reach them. He glares up at Alexander and Mara and then snaps open his h jaws, screeching in frustration -- Then the Morlock below VAULTS from his horse and scales u the tower after Alexander and Mara -- he climbs very quic his great jaws snapping -- they scramble to keep above hi desperately climbing -- the Morlock is almost on them whe They see Kalen -- lost amidst the panic below -- the Morl horses pounding around him -- a frenzy of horror --

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: (to Mara)

dialogues.speaker: -- GO GET HIM
dialogues.text: Alexander instantly leaps down on the Morlock pursing the allowing Mara to scale down after Kalen -- The Morlock grapples with Alexander briefly -- essentiall tossing him aside -- Alexander falls and then lands hard scaffolding below -- As Mara leaps down and begins racing through the chaos fo Kalen -- The Morlock on the tower spins around and scales down aft her quickly -- But Alexander sees that Mara is almost to Kalen -- When SUDDENLY the ground ERUPTS directly before Mara -- a Morlock BURST up from the hole and LEAPS on Mara like a l  on a gazelle -- He grabs her with his great claws -- Alexander watches, impotent -- as the Morlock drags Mara down the hole, amazingly quickly -- Then from the forest -- another blast of the horn. And everything abruptly stops. The Morlock instantly stop pursuing -- the Eloi stop running. A frozen moment and then... The horn call ends. The Morlock spin their horses and gallop into the dark forest, disappearing with their prey. The Eloi look around, slightly dazed, their panic ended a someone flipped a switch. Alexander sees Kalen's face. It is too painful. Alexander closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander stands, frustrated, with Korus and a few Eloi. Braziers burn around the village.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Where do they take them?! KORUS. We don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: We have to go after them, find where -- ! KORUS. Alexander, I know you're trying to help. But they don't come back.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What do you mean?!

dialogues.speaker: KORUS
dialogues.text: They've gone to a better place.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You know that's not true. KORUS. We choose to believe it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: My God! How can you just do  nothing!? They're your friends, your family. You all knew Mara. You ate with her and worked with her... Your work in the valley, what is that for if not to --

dialogues.speaker: ELOI MAN
dialogues.text: To find our place in the world and --

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: No -- it's more than that. When you create something you say to the world: I was here. I mean something. How can you just let that be taken away from you?! KORUS. This is out life, Alexander. It's a hard life but it is how we have always lived.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Then it's time to change that -- KORUS. (firm) We are what we are. A tense beat.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You won't even try? KORUS. We can't change the day and the night, Alexander. This is the world. Alexander sees Kalen standing at the door to his house.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Why don't you try telling him that? He strides off toward Kalen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander sits across from Kalen. Silence. Kalen goes to him. Sits next to him. Strangely comforting

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: This is how things happen. It happened to my father. My mother  said if we remember him every day he'll always be here and we'll feel better. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: I remember him before I go to sleep. We built a table once. I remember that. He leans his head on Alexander's shoulder. Both rememberi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More of the shared Eloi dream we saw before... We are moving through the desert... the sun is setting... desert sand burns red in the sunset... And then a shape appears in the distance -- we sweep forw -- it is hulking -- predatory -- sparkling red as if the setting sun is reflecting from shining metal -- Glowing red -- a great bird of prey -- blazing in the sun now -- enormous coiled shoulders -- sharp talons -- stran metallic -- Then the huge head lunges forward -- the curved beak snap open -- devouring us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander bolts awake -- sweating -- terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander stands at the doorway, watching the Eloi troop to work.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: You're thinking about her... Alexander turns, Kalen is standing in the room.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yes. Kalen goes to him.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: She didn't want me to be a climber. She wanted me to be a planner like her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Kalen.  They watch the Eloi troop off to work for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: How can they just go back to work as if nothing happened?

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: What else can they do?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Kalen... Do you have any idea where they take them?

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: We're not supposed to think about it. But I dream about it sometimes... Kalen is deep in thought. He finally comes out with it hesitant.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: There's a place that might help... we could try going there.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: The Hall of Books.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You have books?! Kalen, you've got to take me there. There might be history. Records. Something to help us find where the Morlocks took --

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have mentioned it. We can't go there.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: Why? Kalen looks at him. Deadly serious.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: Because it's haunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander and Kalen are making their way through a dense jungle path, long overgrown.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: No one ever comes here. My mother told me stories about it late at night. They tell all the children.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What kind of stories?

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: About the voice in the darkness. About the ghosts... They push through some tangled vines. A gaping tunnel ope into the earth ahead of them. They stop. Kalen considers the dark opening. He bravely steels himself.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: Climbers should go first. Then he continues on, Alexander following. They begin to down into the tunnel, pushing aside overgrown vines and foliage. No one has been this way for a great many years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They descend the dank tunnel. Here and there shafts of sunlight shoot down from holes above.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: I had a friend who came here once. Sort of a dare.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: He came back screaming... He never talked about it after that. I don't think he even got this far. Not even noticing, they pass by an imposing figure buried deep in the sediment of the tunnel wall. A stone lion, it great head just protruding from the rock. It is one of the lions from the entrance to the Fifth Ave New York City Public Library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander and Kalen slowly walk into a cavernous chamber shrouded in dust, spiderwebs and cobwebs -- filthy, aband and echoing. Eerie. Around the edges we can just glimpse a sense of something familiar, of our time. They are, in fact, standing in the sad remains of the reading room of the New York City Publ  Library. Massive walls of books. A dazzling shaft of sunlight shoots straight down from a above, creating a pillar of light. Everything else is darkness. Except for a tiny red glow in a far corner of the room. Then a voice, echoing from the red glow:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: May I help you? Alexander and Kalen stop.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: .. It has been one thousand, three hundred and seven years since I have seen a living soul... The glowing red light approaches, ominous...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: And you are alive. I can feel your pulse from here... The glowing red light approaches...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: If I had known you were coming... The glowing red light stops just short of the ray of sunl from above...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I would have baked something. And VOX steps into the pillar of light. He is a truly horrifying sight. A human-shaped robot of sorts. A twisting, hideous collection of circuits and wir pistons and metal. A gaping face-plate. Bits of ashen ski grafted uneasily to rubber and metal. And one very human peering from his wretched visage. The glowing red light comes from deep within his incomple chest cavity. A power source of some kind. He has the same voice as the informational kiosk Alexande spoke to earlier. Vox moves with the strange, jerky gait of a machine well his prime. He lurches about, but with a bizarre sort of elegance.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: My manners have become deplorable  through lack of use. The spiders and the scorpions don't care much, I'm afraid. He smiles, a truly ghastly sight, and perambulates to a bookcase. vox What can I get you, let's see... (he flips through some books) .. Henry James? No, too dreary... Hemingway, perhaps? No, too sweaty. Plato? Proust? Poe? Pinter? Pound? No, something else... ahhhh... I have it... (he hold up a book) .. Jules Verne. He turns to Alexander. vox Right up your alley, I would think. You are from the past, yes?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: How did you know?!

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: I can smell carcinogens and industrial pollutants on your skin that have not been known here for -- (he leans forward and smells Alexander) -- 800,000 years perhaps. Don't keep me in suspense. What year?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: I must say, you look remarkably good. You don't want a book then?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What are you?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: I'm the librarian. I've always been the librarian.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I know you -- you're an automaton of some sort that --

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: An "automaton"?! Please! I'ma  biomechanical organism. Well, what's left of one. What's left of all of them, actually. I am the last... (he sweeps his arms to take in the whole chamber) .. And "these fragments I have shored against my ruins." 1.3. Eliot. You wouldn't know him yet but you'll just love him, he's divine, if a little dour. Very shy though... hiding over here... He jerks away toward another bookcase.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Sir... have you a name? vox I am called Vox... (he jerks quickly to Kalen) .. Now you are Eloi.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: (terrified) Yes... vox Don't be frightened, Vox is here to help. To serve. How may I serve you, child? He leans very close to Kalen. Then quietly and rather cruelly baaa's like a sheep.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Please, we need your help. The Morlocks have taken --

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: (jerking at the word) Morlocks --

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You know of them?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Who doesn't know the Morlocks?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Do you know where they live?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Oh yes... They found our knowledge useful for a time. They used us  much as your people did. Then they decided they had learned enough so they tore us up for spare parts.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: But you escaped.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: I was lucky. The others weren't.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: How have you survived so long? Vox touches the red glow in his chest cavity:

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Regenerating fission reactor, you wouldn't understand. It's power is well beyond your neanderthal cranial capacity.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Can you show us where they live?

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: Please... it's important.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: An Eloi who would seek out the Morlocks? Aren't you a plucky little thing? He stares at Kalen, gauging him. Kalen bravely returns hi stare.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: We need your help.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: (with rising passion) Why should I help you? You primates -- you great, lumbering, hairy animals, drenched in blood from the moment of your hideous conception -- what have you ever used knowledge for but destruction and bloodshed! A little bit of learning and you lay waste to the world! You're no better than the Morlocks!

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: They took my mother!

dialogues.speaker: THEY TOOK MY ENTIRE RACE
dialogues.text: His thundering words echo around the chamber. A beat. Vox calms down. Takes in his massive walls of books. vox But all that's ancient history. I'm safe here. Now I live in serene contemplation. I commune with the great minds of history. Socrates, Aristotle, Shakespeare, Martha Stewart. Why should I risk all of that to help you? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Because you'll never die.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You'll live like this forever. Alone. You were meant to help. To be with people. Not like this. A long beat. vox (darkly) So, Relic, you want to open Pandora's box, do you? See all the mysteries exposed?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: And if the truth is so horrible that it will haunt your dreams for all time?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I'm used to that. Vox stares at Alexander for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: All right, Dorothy, let's go and see the Wizard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander, Vox and Kalen are making their way down a fore path. Kalen a bit ahead.  Vox talks quietly to Alexander:

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: When was his mother taken?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Last night.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Send him away.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Send him home. You don't want him to see it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Kalen... hold on a minute. Kalen stops. Alexander kneels by him. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I think we should go on by ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Please, just listen to me... Your mother would be very cross with me if you got hurt. I'll find her.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: But you're only a mud carrier.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'll be all right... You go back to the village and light the fire. So we can find our way home.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: I'll wait for you. He hugs Alexander, tightly. And then goes. A beat. Vox watches Alexander, actually moved.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Come on.  He rises and they continue down the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander and Vox are staring up, gazing at something ahe of them. An odd shadow falling across them.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: My God... I saw this.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: It frightens you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: It was meant to. And then we see it... like a vision from the shared Eloi dream... a great metallic bird of prey... coiled muscles. shining red in the light. It is, in fact, one of the gargoyles from the Chrysler Building. The top of the building towers up from the sand Shattered and desolate, looming at an odd angle.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: So, do we go on?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Aren't you a plucky little -- ?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up. He bravely moves past the top of the Chrysler Building, keeping an eye on the frozen gargoyle as he passes. Vox smiles and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great cliffs soar up like dragon's teeth. Alexander and V approach the tallest, sharpest cliff. Like a knife cuttin into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: .. The Morlocks never bother me. Why should they? I'm obsolete. Where's the danger in a book no one wants to read?  Vox notes one of the little squirrel-like creatures. He calmly crushes it under his foot. Alexander is surprised but says nothing. Then Vox stops at the great cliff, gazing up, a complex tornado of emotions flashing across his one human eye.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: (quietly) I have not seen this place for 120,000 years... Very well, Relic. Here's the way in. Alexander stares at the wall of impenetrable stone.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: It's not what you think. Touch it. Alexander slowly reaches forward -- his hand passes throu the stone.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: It's what they want you to see.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: This is the way in?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Yes Are you sure you want to do this?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yes. But you've done enough. Thank you for your help... I hope someday people read your books again. And then Alexander takes a breath and... steps through th wall. Disappearing. Vox stands for a moment. Thinking. And follows Alexander through the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander turns.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: In for a penny, in for a pound. Do you know that saying?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Yes... Thank you. And they turn to face...  The lair of the Morlocks. It is a serpentine network of tunnels that shoot off dramatically in all directions. Some of the tunnels are rough and natural, stalagmites and stalactites gaping lik teeth. Others are smooth and architectural, seeming almos man-made. In the rocks around them, we can just glimpse relics from Old World -- buried under thousands of years of rock formation and evolution -- treasures deep in the sediment Bit of New York -- a building -- a car -- a soda machine twisting subway tracks arching into the darkness. And in the background a steady inhalation and exhalation constant rasping and hollow moaning -- as if the Earth it was breathing. And the low thrum of machinery.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Machines?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Do you know which way? Vox stands frozen... his nightmares coming back to haunt

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Vox?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: This way. They begin to move through a tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although he doesn't know it -- and such a thing would be unknown to him anyway -- Alexander and Vox are traveling the remains of a decaying New York City subway tunnel. They pass bits of crumbling tile on the wall -- the lette "ILR.T." and "42nd Street" are just visible through years grime and geological growth. They move toward the next chamber, the source of the stra breathing and mechanical sounds seems to be coming from t new chamber... They emerge on a ledge high above...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander and Vox peer down, hidden. If Alexander had the knowledge of its existence he would he is above the sunken remains of Madison Square Garden. whole Garden has fallen in on itself at some points, at others the cathedral of metal girders support the ceiling high above. The air around them vibrates and whooshes, the breathing sound roaring. And at last Alexander can see the source.. Machines. Towering, sweating, industrial. A network of enormous pipes and electrical cables and air channels lik the circulator system of a body that twist off in every direction. A sweatshop Hell. A mechanized Dante's Inferno of wood and leather and steel. And the Morlocks are working. All the machines are powere by the brute strength of the Morlocks alone. They labor among the hellish machines -- slowly turning great wheels pulling at enormous bellows and hauling ropes and grindin levers. They are nightmare figures of a Bosch painting. Alexander looks down in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What's it all for?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: The air... the power.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Why did they built it?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: The Morlocks didn't build this. Alexander looks at him. vox Alexander... Listen to me, it was wrong to bring you. You're not going to find what you're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: (grim) Trust me... You don't want to see any more. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Show me. Vox looks at him for a moment. And leads him down another tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tunnel gradually opens out, getting wider and wider, opening to a vast chamber... And as the tunnel opens out, they get a stunning perspect of the whole... Bones. Skeletons. The entire chamber is a vast necropolis They are standing in an enormous hall entirely made up of Eloi bones and skulls and rib cages and complete skeleton Some buried deep into the sediment -- some reaching out f them like grisly nightmare images -- an entire sweeping w of skulls on one side. At other places the bones glisten wetly, fresh kill. Here and there around the chamber holes drop away to blackness, gaping chasms. A silent beat as they take in the horror everywhere aroun them.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: The slaughterhouse. Alexander looks around, shattered.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: They raise them like cattle... Feed them until they're ready and then hunt them.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: (a whisper) How are your dreams now? His words hang in the air for a moment as Alexander takes the gruesome chamber.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: This has to end.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: End...?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: This has to end.  Vox looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: May I help you? Before Alexander can respond -- The ground beside them suddenly EXPLODES up -- bones fly Morlocks ERUPT up from the ground -- Alexander tries to resist -- but he is quickly overpowered -- A Morlock grabs Vox and BRUTALLY flings him aside -- Vox falls into a gaping hole -- sailing down -- SLAMMING agai the sides of the abyss -- his body RECOILING grotesquely a rag doll, shattered -- he CRASHES to the bottom of the chasm, lies still -- Above, a Morlock leans over the defeated Alexander, he op his enormous jaws wide and screeches down at Alexander, inches away, Alexander can see into his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Morlocks are leading Alexander down a long, sloping tunnel, deeper and deeper and deeper. But this tunnel is different. It evolves from the natural subterranean and bone caves o the Morlocks to rough walls and then walls with decaying frescos and tapestries. It is as if Alexander is walking through a microcosm of man's development. A tall figure is waiting ahead of them in the deep darkne of the tunnel. The Morlocks stop, Alexander as well. Alexander peers at the figure, trying to see. Too dark. Then a voice. Surprisingly gentle.

dialogues.speaker: GENTLE VOICE
dialogues.text: I won't be what you expect... A beat.

dialogues.speaker: GENTLE VOICE
dialogues.text: We're not really so different, you and I. Then a light. A pulsing bio-electric glow radiates from t figure, illuminating it from within, and Alexander sees.. The UBER-MORLOCK OVERLORD. The Uber-Morlocks are strange creatures. The centuries of living deep underground without any physical activity hav left them anemic and enervated. They are fragile, weak,  elongated creatures. Their skin is almost translucent -- like bizarre mutations of a man and a silverfish. A beat as Alexander takes in this eerie figure. The Overl bears a disturbing resemblance to Dean Fulton.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: It's bio-electric illumination. Like certain deep sea creatures from your own time. He moves to Alexander. The Uber-Morlocks move slowly, alm having lost ambulatory power. The Overlord stops close. Studies Alexander. Then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Come... see your future. He ushers Alexander into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breathtaking cacophony of the past and the future. A serpentine honeycomb of chambers that combine a Victori Jules Verne sense of the "future" with artifacts from our world: obelisks of cars and computers; towers of scientif equipment alongside rotting advertising posters and prese animals floating in huge tanks. Mammoth columns of decaying books soaring up like monolit Vast towers of enormous tomes of every description. Here and there in the murky darkness of the network of ro we see flickering lights -- decaying power cables -- the and sputter of some machinery in the shadows. The Overlord slowly leads Alexander through the network o chambers, past the amazing artifacts.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Alexander.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Well, Alexander, as a fellow scientist I know you have a thousand questions --

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You came underground when the world was ending above. And you evolved. Some into the Morlocks and others --

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: No, we created the Morlocks.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Created?

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: You wouldn't understand. We genetically engineered the Morlock class to serve our needs.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: As slaves.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: To work the machines and build the tunnels. You can't imagine what it was like when it all started. We survived for millennia, scraping the lichen and microscopic organisms from the rock with our teeth and digging for water with our nails. Endlessly. For generations. And we... became. The Overlord continues to lead Alexander through the chambers, the two Morlocks following. Alexander can see t the Morlocks are clearly terrified by the Overlord. A few other Uber-Morlocks lurk in the darkness of the cor and high walls of the chambers.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: And centuries later when we tried to emerge into the sun again, we couldn't. Our adaptation was too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: successful. We survived we endured... for this.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: How do you control the Morlocks?

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: We make them see what we wish.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: As our bodies atrophied our minds... compensated. The two Morlocks following suddenly stop -- mind control the Overlord freezing them in their tracks. The Overlord continues to walk with Alexander.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: And what of the Eloi?

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: They survived above. Became what they are.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: No... they didn't survive only to be your food. You did that.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: I'm afraid your indignation is lost here. I have no more "human" response to the Eloi then you would have to a carrot. It's just how we live now.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: But this is barbaric! Have you completely lost all sense of --

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: (stops, calm) And who are you, Alexander? Who are you to question thousands of years of evolution? This is the world now. I am fact.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: It can't all be like this... They continue walking.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Underground and above. Light and dark. Predator and prey. There is nothing else. There is not even a desire for anything else. We have finally arrived at... stasis. Which brings us to the problem of you... You can see that you have no place here. Your blood, your offspring, your ideas just don't belong anymore. So... They round a corner to another chamber. And the Time Machine is sitting before them.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: .. You're free to go. A stunning bell tower looms through the sediment just abo the Time Machine. It is a huge clock face from the front some long lost building. The huge bell silent. The hands still for generations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Go back to where you came from. Or die here.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Why would you let me go back?

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Because the past is immutable. Frozen. Dead... And you are the past. A beat as the Overlord gazed at Alexander dispassionately

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Say I just come back again?

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Alexander, yours is a world of brocade and velvet, not tooth and claw. Why would you come back to this? To save a few cattle? No.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I could tell them. Warm them of what's to come. The Overlord gazed at him deeply. Then with strange poignancy.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Please, warn them. No one will ever believe... we have come to this. Then a weak voice, echoing from the darkness down the corridor...

dialogues.speaker: MARA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Alexander... Alexander spins around -- races across the chamber -- the Overlord slowly follows -- And Alexander discovers Mara, almost lost in the incredib Baroque chaos of the chamber. She is hanging on a wall, leather straps holding her in place. Filthy plastic IV tu connect her to some chugging medical equipment. Alexander reaches up to grasp her hand, can just reach he

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Mara... Mara weakly raises her head -- a shocking sight -- alrea her skin is becoming strangely translucent, her veins beginning to show through.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: No... Mara tries to speak, cannot. Alexander stands for a beat, holding her hand. Then, without turning:

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: We have lost the capacity to reproduce. But the species must continue.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: So you take their best...

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: When a creature shows too much independent thought we remove them from the gene pool. We're breeding them for submission. Soon they will be fully domesticated.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (quietly) You took her because she helped me.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Yes. Initiative and daring are not desirable traits in the Eloi. But you should be happy for her. She won't remember the creature she was. She will... become. A beat. Alexander looks up at Mara deeply.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: She won't remember you. None of them will. You will be forgotten. That is how history works.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: A man can change his history.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: After all you've seen... after man's entire journey... you still believe that? Alexander slowly turns to the Overlord, his eyes burning, fury mounting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now will you go?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: No... Alexander steps towards the Overlord, threatening.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: This has to end. The Overlord steps back. A frail creature, he is no match for Alexander. He has no defense. But for one.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Her name... was Emma. Alexander stops.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: If I can only find the right door... the lady or the tiger...

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: It's always the tiger for you, Alexander, haven't you learned that by now?... He glances to Mara, strapped to the wall, her head hangin limp.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: ... It wasn't possible then and it isn't possible now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Overlord slowly moves to Alexander, his eyes burning Alexander's, his voice low and steady, hypnotic.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Past... present... future... it's all the same ribbon. You can't change a thing. Not a moment. Not a molecule... You never could. The Overlord is very close. A whisper:

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: You came 800,000 years not to relive it. But you are reliving it. How can you watch it again? Alexander looks at him, pain in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go... before it's too late... Accept what is destined to be. Go back to your own time. The future's finished for you... Alexander looks at Mara. Then he slowly turns his back on her and steps to the Time Machine.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: That's right... go back... Tell them of your journey. Of your destiny. This was all... meant to be. Alexander stands at the Time Machine. Then he reaches forward and gently throws the Time Machin control lever -- The Overlord is stunned -- Alexander withdraws his hand and turns to the Overlord.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Not this time. A high-pitched whine -- building -- the world undulates around the Time Machine -- And then it is gone. The Overlord gapes at Alexander.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: That was a foolish thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I'm a foolish man. Alexander begins to circle the Overlord.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: I could have a hundred Morlocks here in thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Does this prove something to you? Have you made some great stand of which I'm unaware? Alexander continues to circle, the Overlord matching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of running.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: Oh, you won't be running for long... Alexander stops. The Overlord stops as well. The Overlord is now standing where the Time Machine was. A tense stand off.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: But you've earned a reward for your valor. I think you should become. You'll like it here. Once you get used to the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I don't think that's going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: And why not?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Because... He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Time's up. Before the Overlord can react -- a buzzing sound -- the w undulating around him -- his eyes shoot wide with realization -- And the Time Machine reappears -- appearing through the Overlord -- the Overlord is torn apart -- the Time Machin forcing it's way through his body -- Splat. The spacial and auditory vibration caused by the reappear of the Time Machine cascades through the chamber -- and t great clock face above suddenly shifts -- its bell tollin loudly -- the bell swaying back and forth unsteadily -- Alexander races to Mara -- urgently tearing her from the -- she collapses down into his arms -- As the huge clock begins to crumble from the wall -- Alexander turns to see -- The great clock face finally falling -- On top of the Time Machine. Smashing it to pieces.  Alexander gathers Mara up and begins racing out of the chamber. Another Uber-Morlock reaches for them from the shadows -- Alexander easily knocks the anemic creature aside and continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander is carrying Mara quickly through the grisly Hal Bones, trying to remember his way out -- Then a hulking figure appears ahead of him. And another. Two Morlocks. Alexander quickly sets Mara down and snatch up a bone to use as a weapon. The two Morlocks circle him, almost toying with him -- th they attack -- Alexander fights them but is almost immediately overpowered -- they roughly shove him to his knees, preparing to dispatch him when -- A voice, Vox:

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: That's quite enough of that, you great bloated ticks. The Morlocks spin to Vox, surprised -- he stands proudly few feet away -- Alexander instantly drives up and SLAMS one of the Morlocks -- The other springs for Vox -- jaws snapping -- Vox thrusts an arm -- the Morlock crashes into him -- clamping his ja down on Vox's forearms -- they fall to the ground -- Alexander fights with his Morlock as best he can -- but h woefully overpowered -- the Morlock slashes at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Morlock continues to bite down on Vox's forearm Vox smiles --

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: That's titanium, you idiot. He powers forward with his other hand and grabs the Morlo throat, squeezing the life out of him as the Morlock slas at him brutally -- Meanwhile, Alexander is having a bad time of it -- the Morlock springs away from him into the darkness of the chamber -- clinging to the walls and scaling along them quickly like a spider -- and then vaults back and slashes Alexander -- Alexander spins -- wounded -- falls. The Morlock hunches, coiling for the kill -- Alexander rolls over, pulling something from his vest -- box of matches -- the Morlock races forward to destroy hi Alexander desperately strikes a match -- a sudden phosphorescent flare from the match -- the Morlock stops, stunned, blinded for a moment -- And then the Morlock jerks, stiffens -- amazed -- as Vox' titanium arm shoots through him from behind -- Vox's fist explodes through the Morlock's chest. Vox jerks his hand free as the Morlock falls. Then a look of surprise passes across Vox's face... to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Vox --

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Imagine that... he sinks seems that little devil got my power relays... Viscous fluid begins to trickle down his face plate.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: (smiles) Takes a licking but ticking... (his head jerks keeps on oddly) .. For a while anyway.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Nothing to do, I'm afraid. just a librarian after all. Tell me what to do. I'm Wasn't exactly made for all this swashbuckling. though. know Byron?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Vox...

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: I'm babbling. Good to talk to for a change... Take her out of need to go. here... (he jerks again, Very Byronic end, I appreciate that. Do you to have someone But you in pain) .. I don't have long.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I won't leave you like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to the light. You weren't made for this. I was... I was made for this moment.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: I'm going to end it, Alexander. As we discussed... He touches the red glow of the reactor in his

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: .. It'll only take a moment. One interrupted circuit, a few atoms smashing together and this will all be history. I'll give you as much time as I can... help me up. Alexander helps Vox to his feet. vox Now get out of my sight, you hideous primate.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I'll never forget this.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: I should hope not... (he jerks again in pain) .. Alexander... Make them read my books. Tell them who they are. Who they could be.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I will... A difficult beat.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: Tick-tick-tick -- better scamper along now. Alexander picks up Mara and sprints off. Vox slowly turns toward the Machinery Cavern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: chest. Alexander makes his way with Mara up the decaying subway tunnel. Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Morlocks are absorbed in their mindless toil, as they have been for generations. Slaving and sweating at the gr machines. Vox slowly limps into the chamber. He is near the end, fl flowing down his face, moving with difficulty. The Morlocks notices him, surprised. Vox just continues t limp into the center of the cavern. The Morlocks begin to surround him, circling him, predato Vox looks at the Morlocks surrounding him. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: VOX
dialogues.text: May I help you? Then he reaches deep into his gaping chest cavity -- And the world explodes -- A terrific reaction -- a cascading shock wave that tears through the chamber -- the entire cavern begins to implod from the violent percussions --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shock wave from the explosion rips through the slaughterhouse -- destroying everything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shock wave tears through the chambers. The entire Ube Morlock world crumbles, burying the artifacts of man's pa in an avalanche of rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander hears the shock wave nearing -- the world dissolving as the caverns collapse behind him -- he sprin forward with Mara -- the subway tunnels twist and writhe implode behind him -- Alexander sees sunlight ahead -- the way out -- he speeds toward the light --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander races with Mara into the blinding sunlight -- emerging from the gaping tunnel leading to the Morlock's caves -- Just as the final tunnels collapse behind them. Alexander sinks to his knees and looks back. Dust and boulders and earth. Vox has done it. The Morloc world is no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fires burn through the night. The Eloi are standing, amazed, not believing what they se Alexander and Mara. Alive. They walk through the stunned Eloi without a word. Kalen emerges from his house and runs to them. Slow fade to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander walks with Mara and Kalen across a green, grass field.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: .. Well, you wanted to see it.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: This is it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Around here. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yes. Just about here.

dialogues.speaker: KALEN
dialogues.text: But there's nothing here.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: It was different then.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: My laboratory was about... here. And the kitchen was over there, where that tree is. Mrs. Watchit wouldn't allow me in much... but, yes, this is about the kitchen. They continue to move around the world that was Alexander house as we become aware of something else... Almost like ghosts at first. Philby and Mrs. Watchit. Moving around Alexander's house in 1899. Then we see the house and the field simultaneously. The same space, centuries apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to tell you, sir. He's been gone this whole week.

dialogues.speaker: PHILBY
dialogues.text: And you've no idea where he went?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WATCHIT
dialogues.text: No, sir. Philby smiles. They move into the study...

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: And this would be my study. There was an elm tree outside the window then.

dialogues.speaker: PHILBY
dialogues.text: I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WATCHIT
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: PHILBY
dialogues.text: I'm glad he's gone. Maybe he's finally found a place where he can be happy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: This... was my home.

dialogues.speaker: PHILBY
dialogues.text: His home. Alexander puts an arm around Mara. At peace with his past And his future.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Long ago. Alexander, Mara and Kalen and their time slowly disappear we fully come to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Watchit leads Philby to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: PHILBY
dialogues.text: You know, Molly and I were talking about engaging a nanny for Jamie. Someone to live with us and take care of the boy. Would you be interested? They stop at the front door. Mrs. Watchit looks back at t empty house for a moment. Then turns to Philby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I might be. But there'll be some changes made. I run a tight house.

dialogues.speaker: PHILBY
dialogues.text: (smiles) I have no doubt of that. I'll come by in the morning and we'll arrange it. Goodnight, Mrs. Watchit.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WATCHIT
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Mr. Philby. He goes. Mrs. Watchit gently closes the door and turns back to the empty house. She stands for a moment and then, quietly:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WATCHIT
dialogues.text: Godspeed, my fine lad, Godspeed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philby walks away from the house, stops, takes one look b And he looks up at the moon for a moment. Then he takes his bowler hat off and flings it away. He smiles. And continues away. FADE OUT.
